meanings.definition: The loss of the ability to move or feel in part or most of the body.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, he experienced paralyzis in his legs and couldn't walk.
meanings.sent2: The paralyzis in her arms made it difficult for her to pick up objects.
meanings.sent3: During the game of freeze tag, his sudden paralyzis made him an easy target.
meanings.sent4: The fear of failure can sometimes lead to a mental paralyzis that stops us from taking action.
meanings.sent5: The paralyzis of fear gripped her heart as she stood on the edge of the cliff.

meanings.definition: A state of helplessness or inability to act.
meanings.sent1: The paralyzis of indecision prevented him from making any progress.
meanings.sent2: In times of crisis, a sense of paralyzis can overwhelm even the strongest individuals.
meanings.sent3: The paralyzis of analysis made it impossible for her to make a decision.
meanings.sent4: The political gridlock resulted in a paralyzis of government functions.
meanings.sent5: The paralyzis of fear kept her rooted to the spot, unable to move.
